item.description:
Mount Major near West Alton, NH is a rocky summit with extensive views of Lake Winnipesaukee and the Belknap Range, and even the White Mountains in clear weather. The foliage should be close to peak at this time which will adorn the awsome view.

Distance: 3.8 miles round trip
Elevation Gain: 1124 ft
Hike Time: 2.5 hours
Difficulty: Moderate
Trail Condition: Well maintained trail

Trailhead: Parking lot is on the left hand side or Route 11 just 4.2 miles north of the town of Alton Bay. There is a sign on route 11.

Trailhead is on the back right side of the parking lot if you are facing the mountain.

Bring a snack and water.

We can go out for lunch after, if you would like to spend more time in Alton Bay. Let me know if this interest you when your RSVP so, I can search out a place and make reservations.
item.name: Hike to Mount Major State Park
